00073 namespace phys
00074 {
00075     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00076     /// @class MetaCode
00077     /// @headerfile metacode.h
00078     /// @brief This Determines the kind of user input.
00079     /// @details A Metacode contains the data that is passed around with an input
00080     /// event. It stores one type of button press or analog representation (Mouse
00081     /// move, joystick tilt, wheel spin, etc...). If it is an analog representation
00082     /// it will also store how far or how it is pushed, pressed, rotated, or
00083     /// whatever. Several of these can be used in combination to represent button
00084     /// combinations, or complex input combination (like portions of fighter game
00085     /// moves).
00086     /// The first 127 character line up with Ascii, Currently upper lase are
00087     /// omitted for brevity.
00088     ///////////////////////////////////////
00089     class MetaCode
00090     {
00091         public:
00092             /// @enum InputCode
00093             /// @brief The InputCode enum defines all the posible types of inputs.
00094             /// @details It has one entry for each key on a most keyboards. Then it
00095             /// has an entry for most mouse and joystick input methods.
00096             enum InputCode{
00097                 KEY_UNKNOWN                     = 0,    /**< KEY_UNKNOWN This is used for unsupported keys or keys that are not in Unicode. */
00098                 KEY_FIRST                       = 0,    /**< KEY_FIRST Same Value as KEY_UNKOWN, is Guaranteed to be the lowest value of any key. */
00099                 KEY_BACKSPACE           = 8,
00100                 KEY_TAB                         = 9,
00101                 KEY_CLEAR                       = 12,
00102                 KEY_RETURN                      = 13,
00103                 KEY_PAUSE                       = 19,
00104                 KEY_ESCAPE                      = 27,
00105                 KEY_SPACE                       = 32,

00107                 KEY_QUOTEDBL            = 34,

00109                 KEY_DOLLAR                      = 36,
00110                 KEY_AMPERSAND           = 38,
00111                 KEY_QUOTE                       = 39,
00112                 KEY_LEFTPAREN           = 40,
00113                 KEY_RIGHTPAREN          = 41,
00114                 KEY_ASTERISK            = 42,
00115                 KEY_PLUS                        = 43,
00116                 KEY_COMMA                       = 44,
00117                 KEY_MINUS                       = 45,
00118                 KEY_PERIOD                      = 46,
00119                 KEY_SLASH                       = 47,
00120                 KEY_0                           = 48,
00121                 KEY_1                           = 49,
00122                 KEY_2                           = 50,
00123                 KEY_3                           = 51,
00124                 KEY_4                           = 52,
00125                 KEY_5                           = 53,
00126                 KEY_6                           = 54,

00129                 KEY_9                           = 57,
00130                 KEY_COLON                       = 58,
00131                 KEY_SEMICOLON           = 59,
00132                 KEY_LESS                        = 60,
00133                 KEY_EQUALS                      = 61,
00134                 KEY_GREATER                     = 62,
00135                 KEY_QUESTION            = 63,
00136                 KEY_AT                          = 64,
00137                 /*
00138                    Skip uppercase letters
00139                  */
00140                 KEY_LEFTBRACKET         = 91,

00142                 KEY_RIGHTBRACKET        = 93,

00148                 KEY_c                           = 99,
00149                 KEY_d                           = 100,
00150                 KEY_e                           = 101,

00154                 KEY_i                           = 105,

00157                 KEY_l                           = 108,

00159                 KEY_n                           = 110,
00160                 KEY_o                           = 111,
00161                 KEY_p                           = 112,
00162                 KEY_q                           = 113,
00163                 KEY_r                           = 114,
00164                 KEY_s                           = 115,
00165                 KEY_t                           = 116,
00166                 KEY_u                           = 117,
00167                 KEY_v                           = 118,
00168                 KEY_w                           = 119,
00169                 KEY_x                           = 120,
00170                 KEY_y                           = 121,
00171                 KEY_z                           = 122,
00172                 KEY_DELETE                      = 127,
00173                 /* End of ASCII mapped keysyms */
00174                 /* International keyboard syms */
00175                 KEY_WORLD_0                     = 160,          /* 0xA0 */
00176                 KEY_WORLD_1                     = 161,
00177                 KEY_WORLD_2                     = 162,
00178                 KEY_WORLD_3                     = 163,
00179                 KEY_WORLD_4                     = 164,

00273                 KEY_KP0                         = 256,

00392                 JOYSTICK_LAST           = 506,  /// The last JoyStick Event Code, all JoyStick events will be less than this.
00393                 INPUTEVENT_LAST = 512           /// The last Event Code, all event codes will be less than this.
00394             };
00395 
00396             /// @enum ButtonState
00397             /// @brief An Optional listing of value that can be used in a metacode to represent the information of a button press
00398             /// @details This is optional set of values that can make working with buttons easier. The values the engine pass
00399             /// via the the event manager will all use these whereever appropriate.
00400             enum ButtonState{
00401                 BUTTON_LIFTING = -1,    /**< Used when the key stops being pressed. */
00402                 BUTTON_UP = 0,          /**< The default state of a key. */
00403                 BUTTON_PRESSING = 1,    /**< This is used at the exact point in time that a key goes from unpressed to pressed. */
00404                 BUTTON_DOWN = 2         /**< This is used the entire time a key is down.  */
00405             };
00406 
00407             /// @enum MouseWheelState
00408             /// @brief An Optional listing of values that can be used in a metacode Indicate spin of a mouse wheel
00409             /// @details This is optional set of values that can make working with the MouseWheel easier. The values the engine pass
00410             /// via the the event manager will all use these whereever appropriate.
00411             enum MouseWheelState{
00412                 MOUSEWHEEL_UP = 1,          /**< Optionally Used when the MouseWheel is spun up as a Meta Code */
00413                 MOUSEWHEEL_UNCHANGED = 0,   /**< This really isn't used in normal situations, but if a mousewheel event is ever needed when the MouseWheel is unspun */
00414                 MOUSEWHEEL_DOWN = -1        /**< Optionally Used when the MouseWheel is spun Down as a Meta Code */
00415             };
00416 
00417         private:
00418 
00419             //The three values that make a MetaCode Useful
00420             int MetaValue;
00421             short unsigned int ID;
00422             MetaCode::InputCode Code;
00423 
00424             //function that the constructors can call aid initial setup
00425             void Construct(const RawEvent &RawEvent_);
00426             void Construct(const int &MetaValue_, const short unsigned int &ID_, const MetaCode::InputCode &Code_);
00427 
00428             //This assigns a value to Inputcode by doing an efficient low level copy of the correct portion of an SDL_event
00429             //If mishandled this function can corrupt the MetaCode, and it can throw any error memcpy could throw.
00430             static MetaCode::InputCode GetInputCodeFromSDL_KEY(const RawEvent &RawEvent_);
00431 
00432         public:
00433             /// @brief Default constructor
00434             /// @details This sets nothing on the MetaCode and leaves it completely unassigned. Accessing a data member could cause problems
00435             MetaCode();
00436 
00437             /// @brief Descriptive Constructor
00438             /// @details This sets all values in the MetaCode, leaving it in completely ready state. This is the ideal constructor for simulating user input.
00439             /// @param MetaValue_ How much is something moving, tilting, rotating or whatever. For buttons a positive value is pushed, and a negative value is becoming unpressed, and 0 is unpressed.
00440             /// @param ID_ Which input is being activated. For everything except Keyboards codes, this selects which button, which joystick, which mouse which item.
00441             /// @param Code_ Which key or which type of input was pressed. Sqeaky, thinks this has partial unicode support.
00442             MetaCode(const int &MetaValue_, const short unsigned int &ID_, const MetaCode::InputCode &Code_);
00443 
00444             /// @brief The Heavy Lifting Constructor
00445             /// @details This contructor accepts a RawEvent from the input event subsystem internal to the engine. This converts all the required information
00446             /// from the lower level format and store what is needed in the event that is created. This is used heavily by engine internals. \n
00447             /// This constructor expects to receive a type of RawEvent that can be converted into exactly one kind of Metacode. Depending on the
00448             /// User input subsystem, this could be all RawEvents, or even just some RawEvents.
00449             /// @exception "RawEvent which creates Multiple Metacodes inserted into Metacode" - Thrown when passed a certain (system dependant) incorrect type of RawEvent.
00450             /// @exception "Unknown User Input Inserted into Metacode" - Thrown when receiving either a corrupt, improperly handle, or unsupported RawEvent.
00451             /// @warning We recomend against using this Constructor, because the binary format of RawEvent could change if the input event SubSystem Changes. In
00452             /// that event you would have to recompile your application to get it working with a new version of physgame. Using this function in Game code removes any gaurantees of Game Code
00453             /// Portability.
00454             MetaCode(const RawEvent &RawEvent_);
00455 
00456             /// @brief This Returns the Inputcode
00457             /// @details This Value can be use to determine what keyboard button has been pressed, or what specific kind of Joystick or mouse event has occurred.
00458             /// This value can be set with @ref SetCode .
00459             /// @return This returns the input code for this MetaCode
00460             MetaCode::InputCode GetCode() const;
00461 
00462             /// @brief This Sets The InputCode
00463             /// @details See @ref GetCode to see exactly what the Code is. This will Set the code stored in this MetaCode. This value can be retrieved with @ref GetCode .
00464             /// @param Code_ The value you want the stored code to become.
00465             void SetCode(const MetaCode::InputCode &Code_);
00466 
00467             /// @brief This Returns the MetaValue
00468             /// @details The MetaValue can be use to determine how far something is tilted, pushed, rotated, or other analog value.
00469             /// This value can be set with @ref SetMetaValue .
00470             /// @return This returns the input code for this MetaCode. For keyboard Buttons this will be
00471             /// 0 if not pressed, 1 if pressed, and -1 if it was pressed and just released. This could return any number inside a range (depending on hardware and configuration)
00472             /// to represent how tilted a joystick or how much a mouse moved.
00473             int GetMetaValue() const;                     //How much is being done? How far has the mouse moved, how much is the throttle pushed.
00474 
00475             /// @brief This Sets The MetaValue
00476             /// @details See @ref GetMetaValue to see exactly what the MetaValue is. This will set the MetaValue stored in this MetaCode. This value can be retrieved with @ref GetMetaValue .
00477             /// @param MetaValue_ Teh value you want the stored MetaValue to become. No bounds checking will be done. You can supply a completely invalid value if you choose to.
00478             void SetMetaValue(const int &MetaValue_);      //For button presses a positive value is pushed and a zero means unpushed
00479 
00480             /// @brief This Returns the Input ID
00481             /// @details The Input ID can be used to differentiate between which Joystick axis is being manipulated, or which mouse button is being pushed.
00482             /// On systems that support multiple keyboards this will even differentiate between those.
00483             /// This value can be set with @ref SetID .
00484             /// @return This returns the input ID, which (on a normal system) can help Identify which Mouse Button, Joystick Button, Joystick Axis,
00485             /// JoystickBall (Horizontal and Vertical), Joystick Hat Axis (those little joysticks on your joystick), but if the system can handle it this
00486             /// can identify from unique input sources and InputCode.
00487             short unsigned int GetID() const;             //Which input is doing it? If this the input was one of may, like which mouse button, which joystick axis.
00488 
00489             /// @brief This Sets The input ID
00490             /// @details See @ref GetID to see exactly what the input ID is. This will set the ID stored in this MetaCode. This value can be retrieved with @ref GetID .
00491             /// @param ID_ The value you want the stored MetaValue to become. No bounds checking will be done. You can supply a completely invalid value if you choose to.
00492             void SetID(const short unsigned int &ID_);
00493 
00494             /// @brief Compares two MetaCodes for equality
00495             /// @details This returns true if the MetaValue and Code are the Same, this ignores ID.
00496             bool operator==(const MetaCode &other) const;
00497     };
00498 }
00499 
00500 /// @brief Allows for streaming of MetaCodes
00501 /// @details If it can be streamed, then it can be logged Holds true for the MetaCode.
00502 std::ostream& operator << (std::ostream& stream, const phys::MetaCode& x);
00503 
00504 #endif
